intro: Athyrus, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asparagaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plants are native to southern Africa and are often cultivated for their ornamental value. They thrive in well-drained soil and require full sun to partial shade. Athyrus species are also valued for their ability to tolerate drought conditions, making them suitable for xeriscaping.
